talents.name: Commune with Divinity
effect: Maintain your Composure at Challenge 3 to align yourself with the divine. Gain Hits in Concordance. Your Concordance measures how closely you are aligned with your Divine Doctrine.
You may use this Ability without using an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint.  If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 8 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Divine Doctrine
effect:
You follow set of principles in your belief system or religious practice, referred to as your Divine Doctrine. Each Divine Doctrine consists of Virtues, Taboos, and Domains.
When you act against your Virtues or engage in a Taboo, reduce your Concordance by 1.

Select two items from the list below to be your Virtues and two items to be your Taboos:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Courage, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .

Select 2 Effect Skills from the list below to be your Domain:
Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Rime, Tempest, Vivus

Commitment to your Divine Doctrine lets you access Rites. If one your Rite's result set contains a 1, reduce your Concordance by 1.
If you attempt to use a Rite when you Concordance is below 0, add 1 Hazard die to the roll for each point your Concordance is below 0.

talents.name: Seek Mysteries

Intuit, Research, or use your Insight to unravel these mysteries further, gaining Hits in Arcana Ranks to invest in your Arcana.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 4 Actions.

talents.name: Strain Susceptibility
effect: Your pursuit of Arcana expose you to Strain.
When you roll one of your Affinity to invoke and Arcana, you gain Strain according to the result as soon as the Arcana effects resolve.
Strain accumulates over the course of your adventures, only reducing by 1d6 at the conclusion of a Waypoint.

You suffer the effects of Strain according to the Straing Effects Table table below. Strain Effects are cumulative:
Strain Effect
0-4 No effect
5-9 Fatigued 1
10-14 Confused
15-19 Fatigued 2
20-24 Vulnerable 3
25-29 Stunned 4
30+ Dead

talents.name: Observant
effect: You can use a Shift to Perceive or Investigate when gathering information or searching for clues.

talents.name: Interrogator
effect: Persuade or Intimidate a target you are questioning, adding +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Investigate 3
effect: Increase your Investigation Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Deductive Reasoning
effect: Analyze the facts and data, adding +1d4 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Shadow the Perp
effect: Use Stealth to follow or observe a target without being noticed, adding +1d4 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Analyze 3
effect: Increase your Analyze Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Intuitive Insight
effect: Use your Insight to determine if your target is lying or to sense their intentions, adding +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Informant Network
effect:
You maintain a network of informants and are skilled at finding enterprising local to gather valuable intelligence. You may spend Wealth while in a city and ask the BAMF X questions, where X is the amount of Wealth spent. Then, Deceive your informants to cover your tracks.
The BAMF will provide your answers at a time that makes sense in the game fiction.

talents.name: Heightened Awareness
effect: When you are the target of an Ambush and make an Initiative Test, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Logical Conclusion
effect: You can draw accurate conclusions from limited information.  Spend 3 Momentum to state yoru conclusion.  The BAMF will tell you if you are correct.

talents.name: Master Investigator
effect: Use a Shift to Investigate, then Analyze your findings, summing the Hits in both result sets.

talents.name: Persuade (2)
effect: Increase your Persuade Rank to 2 {d8).

talents.name: Nobody's Fool
effect: Nothing slips by you while engaged in social Contests, scoring +2 Bonus Hits when using Insight or Persuade.

talents.name: Silver Tongue
effect: Persuade your target, adding +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Browbeat
effect: Intimidate your opponent while engaged in a Contest, adding +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Deceive (2)
effect: Increase your Deceive Rank to 2 {d8).

talents.name: Unflappable
effect: When you Recover to regain Nerve, regain and additional +2 Bonus Hits.

talents.name: Persuade (3)
effect: Increase your Persuade Rank to 3 {d10).

talents.name: Steel Nerves
effect: When you take 4+ Hits and Nerve is your Primary Defense, spend 4 Momentum to immediately regain 3 Nerve.

talents.name: Let's Be Civilized
effect: Once per Waypoint, you may attempt to avert a Combat encounter with sentient creatures by entering into negotiations.

On the turn of the first round of a Combat before the first attack is made, Persuade your enemies.
  • If Hits + Savvy > Challenge: Set the Momentum to 0 & your enemies pause to hear your offer.
  • If Hits + Savvy <= Challenge: Your team loses the Intiative & a number of enemies equal to Hits are Provoked by you.

talents.name: Attune with Nature
effect: Endure or use your Insight to connect with nature, gaining Hits in Attunement.
Attunment measures the strength of connection to nature, which determines the strength of the Marvels you can manifest.
If the result set of one of your Marvels contains a 1, reduce your Atttunement by X, where X is equal to Hits in the same result set.
If your Attunement equals 0 or less, you gain Fatigued 4 and the Momentum decreases by -2.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 7 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Nature's Bond
effect: You possess an innate bond with nature and the natural world.

When you gain this Talent, you gain the following two Effect Skills as your Affinity allowing you to further empower your Marvels and Effect Triggers:
Phylla, Tellus

talents.name: Nourish the Bond
effect:
Select 2 additional Effect Skills from the list below to add to your Afinity:
Plaga, Rime, Squall, Torrent

talents.name: Temper the Bond
effect:
Select 2 additional Effect Skills from the list below to add to your Afinity:
Inferno, Rime, Tempest, Torrent, Vivus

talents.name: Affinity (2)
effect: Increase one of your Affinity Ranks to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Wild Talker
effect: Use Linguistics to ask one natural animal in yoru Current Zone X questions, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Affinity (2)
effect: Increase one of your Affinity Ranks to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Endure (2)
effect: Increase your Endure Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Insight (2)
effect: Increase your Insight Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Affinity (3)
effect: Increase one of your Affinity Ranks to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Insight (3)
effect: Increase your Insight Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Endure (3)
effect: Increase your Endure Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Nature's Wrath
effect: Spend X Attunement and spend an Action to use two Marvels.  You can add +X bonus Hits to either Marvel's result set.
Your Attunement decreases to 0.

talents.name: Quick Draw
effect: You can draw or change weapons without using a Shift.

talents.name: Veteran Competitor
effect: You can Initiate a Contest with one hostile target in your Current Zone without using a Shift.

talents.name: Riposte
effect: Counterattack an enemy Strike that just scored 0 Hits.  Deal 1d4 bonus Hits.

talents.name: Deadly Contestant
effect: When you Strike a target while engaged in a Contest, add +2 Bonus Hits to the results set.

talents.name: Draw Steel
effect: When you Strike a target in the first round of a Contest, add +2 Bonus Hits to the results set.

talents.name: Renowned Victor
effect: When you Strike your opponent to win a Contest, gain +1 Renown.

talents.name: Embrace the Cycle
effect: When you gain this Talent, increase you Vivus Rank to 2 (d8).
You can use Techniques that call on the Vivus Skill.

talents.name: The Cycle's Drain
effect: If one your Techniques's result set contains a 1, you suffer a number of Hits equal to the Technique's Threshold to your Grit.

talents.name: Aim
effect: Use a Shift to aim carefully, then immediately Shoot your target at -1d Challenge.  Add +1d4 bonus Hits to the result set (bonus Hits do not count 1s against Initiative).

talents.name: Survival (3)
effect: Increase you Survival Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Silent Stalker
effect: When you use Stealth in a wilderness environment, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Natural Camoflauge
effect: Use Stealth to conceal yourself while in a natural environment.  Until you take use a Shift or Action, you gain Hidden X, where X is equal to 8+Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Perceive (2)
effect: Increase your Perceive Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Shoot (2)
effect: Increase your Shoot Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Predator’s Instinct
effect: Focus to enter a heightened state of awareness, adding +1d4 Bonus Hits to your next Shoot attempt or Initiative Test.

talents.name: Keen Tracker
effect: When you use Survival to track and locate a target, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Silent Movement
effect: When you use Stealth to move through hostile or unfamiliar territory, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Disguise Expert
effect: Deceive the world to gain Disguised X, where X is euqal to Hits in the result set.  You cannot use this ability if you are being observed by an enemy.

talents.name: Stealth (3)
effect: Increase your Stealth Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Stealth (4)
effect: Increase your Stealth Rank to 4 (d12).

talents.name: Deceive (2)
effect: Increase your Deceive Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Implements (2)
effect: Increase your Implements Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Implements (3)
effect: Increase your Implements Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Lock Master
effect: Use your Implements to disable a lock blocking your way, adding +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Evasion
effect: When you suffer Hits from an attack that includes targets other than your self and your Reflexes are above 0, reduce Hits by -2.

talents.name: Vanish
effect: Spend Momentum to gain Hidden X, where X is the amount of Momentum spent.

talents.name: Blend In
effect: When you Defy Danger to Hide! while in a Zone with a crowd, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Spy Network
effect:
You maintain a network of informants and are skilled at finding enterprising local to gather valuable intelligence. You may spend Wealth while in a city and ask the BAMF X questions, where X is the amount of Wealth spent. Then, Deceive your informants to cover your tracks.
The BAMF will provide your answers at a time that makes sense in the game fiction.

talents.name: Mimicry
effect: Deceive your opponents while Hidden, adding +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Counter-Surveillance
effect: Perceive to detect hidden observers or surveillance devices, adding +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Escape Artist
effect: When you attempt to escape being Restrained, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Deep Cover
effect: You maintain false identities to use for subtly gathering information.  You have a number of these identities equal to your Infiltrator Rank.

talents.name: Forgery
effect: Use your Craft, Implements, or Linguistics to forge documents or objects, adding +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Master of Subterfuge
effect: When you Deceive or use Legerdemain to create a diversion, Create 2 Advantages in your Current Zone.

talents.name: Infiltrator's Instincts
effect: When you are the target of an Ambush and make an Initiative Test, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Chivalric Obligation
effect: Your elevated status requires that you show bravery, strength, and conviction in all your affairs.

Chivalric Obligations require three (3) Virtues, one of which is Courage &mdash braving danger and facing fear or defeat without hesitation.
Select two other Virtue from the list below:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .
You gain Dedication which measures your commitment to yoru Chivalric Obligation.  When you gain this Talent, your Dedication equals 3.
Whenever you act against your Virtues, reduce your Dedication by -1. If your Dedication is 0 or less, increase the Entropy by +5.

talents.name: Noble Bearing
effect: When you Persuade a target in a formal setting, add +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Valorous Recognition
effect: Gain +1 Renown and +1 Wealth

talents.name: Armor Training
effect: You gain an addition +2 rating from any Armor you equip.

talents.name: Dedicated Exemplar
effect: Spend X Dedication to add X Hits to your next roll.

talents.name: Virtuous Act
effect: When you act in concordance with one or more of your Virtues, increase your Dedication by +2.

talents.name: Strike (3)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Noble Warrion
effect: Increase your Tactics Rank to 2 (d8) and your Composure Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: History (2)
effect: Increase your History Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Inspiring Vanquish
effect: When you score Hits and kill a targer, one ally you can see in your Currnet Zone may immediately use the Recover action.

talents.name: Renowned Warrior
effect: When you gain this talent, Gain +2 Renown.
Once per Waypoint, you may invoke your Knightly status to gain audience with an important figure who recognizes valor.

talents.name: Atoning Act
effect: Spend 4 Momentum to increase your Dedication by +3.

talents.name: Unwavering Dedication
effect: When your Dedication goes below 1, you may spend 5 Grit to increase your Dedication by +1.

talents.name: A Noble End
effect: When you are Dying, you may increase your Dying rating to 4, accepting an honorable daeth.
If you do, all allies in the current Encounter can immediately use Recover without using an Action and the current Timer increases by +2.

talents.name: Momentous Act
effect: Spend 2 Momentum, then take an Action.  If there are no 1s in the result set, increase the Momentum by +5.

talents.name: Spellburn
effect: When a Spell you use has a 1 in the result set, you suffer Hits equal to the Spell's lowest Threshold.

talents.name: Study Spells
effect: Research the magical secrets and recipes that empower your Spells.
You gain Hits in Spell Ranks to invest in your Spells.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 10 - Savvy Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Spellcraft
effect: Analyze a magical effect you encounter to determine its type, source, and/or effects.

talents.name: Research (2)
effect: Increase your Research Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Magical Affinity
effect:
When you gain this Talent, select 1 Effect Skills from the list below to be an Affinity allowing you to further empower your Spells with Skill Talents:
Aether, Forma, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nihil, Nox, Phylla, Plaga, Rime, Squall, Tellus, Tempest, Torrent, Vivus

talents.name: Affinity (2)
effect: Increase your Affinity Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Magical Affinity
effect:
When you gain this Talent, select 1 Effect Skills from the list below to be an Affinity allowing you to further empower your Spells with Skill Talents:
Aether, Forma, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nihil, Nox, Phylla, Plaga, Rime, Squall, Tellus, Tempest, Torrent, Vivus

talents.name: Aim
effect: Use a Shift to aim carefully, then immediately Shoot your target at -1d Challenge.  Add +1d4 bonus Hits to the result set (bonus Hits do not count 1s against Initiative).

talents.name: Patient Shot
effect: Use a Shift to Wait For It with the condition that an ally scores 1+ Hits against your target in melee combat.  When the the condition is met, Shoot your target dealing Hits directly to their Grit.

talents.name: Pinning Shot
effect: Shoot your target, reducing Hits in the result set by -2 but giving your target Restrained 2.

talents.name: Piercing Shots
effect: You know how punch through your targets' defenses, scoring +1 Bonus Hits to their Grit when you score 1+ Hits with Shoot.

talents.name: Reflex Shot
effect: When you are the target on Ambush, you immediately dela +1d4 Bonus Hits to one target.

talents.name: Suppressing Fire
effect: Use your Tactics to fire a ranged weapon in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, protecting your allies by forcing your enemies to seek cover.
Allies can ignore a number of Hazards in the targetted Zone equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Crippling Shot
effect: Shoot your target, redicing Hits in the result set by -2 but giving your target Fatigued 1 and Wounded 1.

talents.name: Two Birds, One Shot
effect: Shoot two targets in your Current or an Adjacent Zon, dividing Hits between the two.

talents.name: Ready
effect: You can use the Use Your Equipment Shift to reload, draw, or restring / unjam a ranged weapon once per turn without using your Shift.

talents.name: Shoot (2)
effect: Increase your Shoot Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Double Tap
effect: Shoot your target at Hazard 3.

talents.name: Shoot (3)
effect: Increase your Shoot Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Shooter
effect: When you Shoot your target but earn 0 Hits, add +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Controlled Pair
effect: When you Shoot a target with no 1s in the result set, you may immediately make a second Shoot attempt.

talents.name: Float like a butterfly. . .
effect: Until the beginning of your next turn, use Reflexes +1d4 as as your Primary Defense.

talents.name: Back Stance
effect: You assume a Defensive Stance, reducing all Hits from using your Martial Arts by -1.
You can maintain this stance until you use a different Shift as long as your Reflexes are above 0.

talents.name: Front Stance
effect: You assume an Aggressive Stance, adding +1 Bonus Hits when using your Martial Arts.
You can maintain this stance until you use a different Shift and as long as your Reflexes are above 0.

talents.name: Martial Arts (2)
effect: Increase your Martial Arts Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Knee Strike
effect: When you are in an Aggressive Stance and score 4+ Hits in melee combat, your target gains Fatigued 2.

talents.name: Ridge Hand Strike
effect: When you are in an Aggressive Stance and score 4+ Hits in melee combat, your taget becomes Dazed.

talents.name: High Block
effect: When you are in a Defensive Stance and take 4+ Hits in melee combat from an attacker you can see, reduce the total hits by 1.

talents.name: Parry
effect: When you are in a Defensive Stance and take Hits in melee combat from an attacker you can see, reduce your Reflexes by 1 and reduce the Hits by 3.

talents.name: Dual Strike
effect: You can split Hits scored by your Martial Arts between 2 melee targets in your Current Zone.

talents.name: Living Weapon
effect: When you use your Martial Arts against your target but earn 0 Hits, add +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Sweep the Leg
effect: Use your Martial Arts against your target and reduce the Hits by -2.  If 1+ Hits remain, your target falls Prone.

talents.name: Counterstrike
effect: When you Parry a melee attack, immediately use your Martial Arts against the attacker at -1 Challenge.

talents.name: First Aid
effect: Use your Medicine to restore 2 Grit to a target in your Zone.

talents.name: Avowed Quest
effect: Your are on a Quest of great importance. Write a new Target with the Quest keyword to represent this undertaking. Work with the BAMF to structure this Target. You may only have one Quest of this type active at a time.
Your Quest grants you Conviction, allowing you to access powers to be used in pursuit of your Quest.  When you gain this Talent, your Conviction equals 5.

As you set out on a Quest, select one Effect Skill from the list below to be your Boon, and gain +1 Skill Rank in the chosen Skill:
Bellor, Destroy, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Vivus
Each time you gain 1+ Milestones from a part of your Quest, your Conviction increases by +5.
If you fail to complete your Quest, lose 1 Renown and increase the Entropy by +5.
If you have no Quest, your Conviction is 0.  You may write a new Target with the Quest keyword at the beginning of the each Waypoint.

talents.name: Strike with Conviction
effect: Spend 2 Conviction.  The next time you Strike, Shoot, or use Martial Arts against a target this turn, automatically us one Effect Trigger from you Boon.

talents.name: Strike (2)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Boon (2)
effect: Increase your Boon Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Relentless Conviction
effect: Increase the Entropy by +2 to regain +3 Conviction

talents.name: Wrathful Conviction
effect: Spend 2 Conviction, then use your Boon to harm your foe scoring Hits against one target in your Current Zone.

talents.name: Eternal Conviction
effect: When you are Dying, you may spend 2 Conviction and increase the Entropy by +4.  You recover from the Dying status, regain 3 Grit, and Recover without using an Action.

talents.name: Strike (3)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Boon (3)
effect: Increase your Boon Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: I Am Inevitable.
effect:
If you succesfully complete every part of a Quest, you may immediately spend 5 Momentum to roll 1d20:
  • If you roll 12+, increase the Momentum by +3. You and all allies gain +1 Milestone, and you gain +2 Renown.
  • If you roll 11 or less, increase the Entropy by +5 and gain +2 Enemies.

talents.name: Double or Nothing
effect: When you take an Action that contains no 1s in the result set without any re-rolls, reduce your Nerve by Hits and roll 1d20.

talents.name: Blooded
effect: You are Resistant to posion damage.

talents.name: Strong Arm
effect: You can Throw weapons into Adjacent Zones.

talents.name: Swift Offense
effect: When you attack a target that has not yet acted in this encounter, add +1d4 Bonus hits to the result set.

talents.name: Smooth Talker
effect: You can spend Momentum to add Hits to the results set of any Action taken to Deceive or Persuade.

talents.name: Recruit Henchmen
effect: Persuade at Challenge 3 to gain Hits + Savvy Henchmen Ranks to recruit Henchmen from the Henchman Minions table.
Henchmen are a type of Minion you can command to do your bidding.
Each type of Henchman has it own Cost which specifies the number of Henchmen Ranks you mus invest to recruit them.
The different Henchmen have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Henchman's Grit reaches 0, they die.  You may compose a letter of condolences to their next of kin if you see fit to stoop.
Your Henchmen wait for your instruction.  On each of your turns, your Henchmen use either a Shift or an Action unless you use a Talent to lead them.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are in a city.  If you use it during a Waypoint while you are in a city, it requires 7 + Savvy Actions (minimum 1 Action).

Advanced Henchmen: Each Henchman also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Henchmen have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Henchman's rating by using the Promote Henchman talent.

talents.name: Promote Henchmen
effect: When you Persuade to Recruit Henchmen, you may spend Henchmen Ranks to increase your current Henchmen's ratings.
Each Henchman rating costs a number of Henchmen Ranks equal to the rating value (i.e., rating 2 = 2 Henchmen Ranks, rating 3 = 3 Henchmen Ranks).

talents.name: Skilled Recruiter
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: When you recruit Minions, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Coordinated Strike
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated melee against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits to the target, where X is the sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Weapons Free!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Lead X Minions to score Hits equal to their Ranged Stat to any number of targets in their Current or an Adjacent Zone, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.

talents.name: Don't Just Stand There!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Lead X Minions to score Hits equal to their Melee Stat to any number of targets in their Current Zone, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.

talents.name: Coordinated Volley
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated ranged attack against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits the the target, where X is the sum of your Minons' Ranged stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: At Ease, Soldiers!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead X Minions in your Current Zone to regain 2 Grit, where X is equal to Hits in the result set. These Minions cannot Shift or take an Action this turn.

talents.name: Rally the Troops
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Spend 4 Momentum to allow all Minions in your Current Zone to regain up to 2 Grit.

talents.name: Lead (2)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 2 {d8).

talents.name: Persuade (2)
effect: Increase your Persuade Rank to 2 {d8).

talents.name: Lead (3)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 3 {d10).

talents.name: Stir the Dead
effect: Use Mori to gain Hits + Mori Haunt Ranks to recruit Haunts from the Haunt Minions table.
Haunts are a type of undead Minion you can command to do you bidding.
Each type of Haunt has it own Cost which specifies the number of Haunts Ranks you mus invest to recruit them.
The different Haunts have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Haunt's Grit reaches 0, they are released from your service and rejoin the souls you've yet to disturb.
Your Haunts wait for your instruction.  On each of your turns, your Haunts use either a Shift or an Action unless you use a Talent to lead them.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are near the spirits or remain of the dead.  If you use it during a Waypoint while you are near the spirits or remain of the dead, it requires 6 - Mori Rank Actions (minimum 1 Action).

Advanced Haunts: Each Haunt also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Haunt have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Haunts's rating by using the Empower Haunts talent.

talents.name: Empower Haunts
effect: When you use Mori to Stir the Dead, you may spend Haunt Ranks to increase your current Haunts' ratings.
Each Haunt rating costs a number of Haunt Ranks equal to the rating value (i.e., rating 2 = 2 Haunt Ranks, rating 3 = 3 Haunt Ranks).

talents.name: Danse Macabre
effect: When you use Mori to Stir the Dead, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Rip and Tear!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated melee against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits to the target, where X is the + sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.
If the target dies, one other target in the same Zone becomes Afraid of your Minions.

talents.name: Feast On Their Flesh!
effect: Lead X Haunts to score 1 Hit against any number of targets in their Current Zones and regain 1 Grit, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.

talents.name: Dread Siphon
effect: Use Mori to score X Hits against one target in your Current Zone, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.
If X is +3+, up to X allies and/or Minions to regain up to 2 Grit.

talents.name: Dread Presence
effect: Intimidate targets in your Current Zone, forcing Hits + your Mori Rank targets to become Afraid of you.

talents.name: Swarm the Enemy
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Lead X Minions to immediately Shift to Move into one target's Current Zone.  Minions must be in a Zone Adjacent to the target Zone.
Once in position, the target suffers X + the sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Death's Reach
effect: Lead your Haunts to launch a coordinated ranged attack against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits the the target, where X is the Hits in the result set + sum of your Haunts Ranged stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Bone Splinters
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: When a Minion dies in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, use Mori.  On 2+ Hits, up to 2 targets in the dead target's Zone take 2 Hits.

talents.name: Lead (2)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 2 {d8).

talents.name: Intimidate (2)
effect: Increase your Intimidate Rank to 2 {d8).

talents.name: Mori (3)
effect: Increase your Mori Rank to 3 {d10).

talents.name: Mori (4)
effect: Increase your Mori Rank to 4 {d12).

talents.name: Corpse Explosion
effect: When a target you can see that has a corporeal form dies in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, use Mori.  On 3+ Hits, all other targets in the dead target's Zone take 2 Hits.

talents.name: Tame Beasts
effect: Maintain your Composure at challenge 3 to gain Hits + Steady Beast Ranks to recruit Beasts from the Beast Minions table.
Beasts are a type of Minion you train to follow your commands.
Each type of Beast has it own Cost which specifies the number of Beast Ranks you must invest to recruit them.
The different Beasts have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Beasts' Grit reaches 0, they die.  You're a terrible person if you let your pets die.
Your Beasts wait for your instruction.  On each of your turns, your Beasts use either a Shift or an Action unless you use a Talent to lead them.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are near a fertile wilderness region.  If you use it during a Waypoint while you are near a fertile wilderness region, it requires 7 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

Advanced Beasts: Each Beast also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Beasts have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Beasts' rating by using the Train Beasts talent.

talents.name: Train Beast
effect: When you maintain your Composure to Tame Beasts, you may spend Beast Ranks to increase your current Beasts' ratings.
Each Beast rating costs a number of Beast Ranks equal to the rating value (i.e., rating 2 = 2 Beast Ranks, rating 3 = 3 Beast Ranks).

Maintain your Composure at Challenge 3 to align yourself with the divine. Gain Hits in Concordance.
Your Concordance measures how closely you are aligned with your Divine Doctrine.

If the result set of one of your Rites contains a 1, reduce your Concordance by 1.
If you attempt to use a Rite when you Concordance is below 0, add 1 Hazard die to the roll for each point your Concordance is below 0.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint.  If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 8 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Divine Doctrine

You follow set of principles in your belief system or religious practice, referred to as your Divine Doctrine. Each Divine Doctrine consists of Virtues, Taboos, and Domains.
When you act against your Virtues or engage in a Taboo, reduce your Concordance by 1.

Select two items from the list below to be your Virtues and two items to be your Taboos:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Courage, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .

Select 2 Effect Skills from the list below to be your Domain:
Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Rime, Tempest, Vivus
Commitment to your Divine Doctrine lets you access Rites.

talents.name: Invoke the Divine

talents.name: Extended Domain

Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Rime, Tempest, Vivus

effect: You can Craft to recite an Epic.

If you lose focus on an Ongoing Epic before completing its final verse, choose one:
  • Lose 1 Renown
  • Decrease the Momentum by -2

talents.name: Consummate Performer
effect: You are unshakable in your performances, allowing you to use Focus or Composure to Maintain Focus on your Ongoing Epics.

talents.name: Strike (1)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 1 (d6).

talents.name: Craft (1)
effect: Increase your Craft Rank to 1 (d6).

talents.name: Composure (2)
effect: Increase your Composure Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Strike (2)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Craft (2)
effect: Increase your Craft Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Renowned Performer
effect: Gain Renown 2.

talents.name: Witchcraft
effect: You gain the ability to cast Hexes on your enemies.

When you gain this Talent, select 2 Effect Skill from the list below to be an Affinity allowing you to further empower your Spells with Skill Talents:
Aether, Forma, Inferno, Mori, Nox, Plaga, Phylla, Rime, Sangui, Tempest
When you lose focus on your Ongoing Hexes, increase the Entropy by +5.

talents.name: Witch's Brew
effect: Craft at Challenge 3 to gain Hits + Savvy in Concoction Ranks to prepare Concocions.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 8 - Craft Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Hexcrafter
effect: When you Focus to Maintain Focus on your Ongoing effects, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Witch's Familiar
effect: Persuade the spirits of the world at Challenge 3 to send you a Beast Minion.  On 1+ Hits, you may recruit a Beast of cost 1 or less from the Beast Minions table.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint.  If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 5 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Affinity (2)
effect: Increase one of your Affinity Ranks to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Not Just Yet, My Pet
effect: When you can see your Beast Minion and it dies, spend 3 Grit to return it to life.

talents.name: Affinity (3)
effect: Increase one of your Affinity Ranks to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Craft (2)
effect: Increase your Craft Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Dangerous Distillation
effect: When you Craft to prepare Concoctions, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Greater Familiar
effect: When you Persuade the spirits of the world to send you a Beast Minon, you may recruit a of cost 2 or less.

talents.name: Blood for Power
effect: When you Focus to Maintain Focus on your Ongoing effects, spend X Grit to add X Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Suplex
effect: Grapple your target, adding +1d4 bonus Hits and making them Prone, but ending their Grapple Status.

talents.name: Sprawl
effect: When an opponet you can see tries to Grapple you, reduce Hits in their result set by -2.

talents.name: O Goshi
effect: When you have an opponent Grappled, you may reduce their Grappled rating by -1 to give them Vulnerable 2.
